title: 100-300 ping unless I disconnect internet
body:
So basically the past couple of weeks I'd get random lag from 100(rarely) to about 220 ping average, usually my family members are doing something like streaming movies or whatever so I know that makes me lag sometimes, but then it started happening when nobody was home and I was the only one on the internet.

I test my ping on speedtest.net before starting a game and it's always 40 ping, then I get in game and it's 200

I don't know why I did this but earlier today it was lagging really badly in a ranked game so I just unplugged my Ethernet cord and waited about 5 seconds and plugged it back in and it went back down to 50 ping for a little until it happened again, and again I did that and it went back down to 50 ping.

I thought maybe my computer had a virus or something so at the moment I'm doing a virus scan, but my brother who's on a separate computer was just lagging and I told him to disconnect from the wifi and reconnect and it fixed it. 

Is there something wrong with my client or what? It's not that bad now that I know I can disconnect and reconnect but it's still annoying.

replies.body:
From your description, it sounds like there are issues with your local network that are causing this. It could be a router setting or the router altogether, but I recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step.

Let me know if you notice any change after working through those steps.
